TopicTitle: Did I finally meet the kraken?

Articles.Content:
Two nights ago I saved my game with a flight to Mun in progress. It was about 1/2 there. Last night I resumed that game. I went to tracking, selected the flight and clicked on fly. When the ship loaded all of the part disconnected from each other and flew in a star burst pattern away from the capsule no explosion or anything. F3 showed nothing. This left the capsule traveling on the same course completely unaffected other than every single part separated from it.

So is this a Kraken or is it some other bug?

Thanks

Side note: I restored a back up and the only way I could get to the flight without the parts flying everywhere, was to select something else like debris,,fly that then from map mode select the flight and switch to it.
yes you met a very minor form of kraken, you got off lucky....
What's with the lac* of *-s? You seem to have inverse *-syndrome!

That's the separation kraken, a minor type that preys on ships that have loaded wrong. It is quite weak, so don't worry.

I met the dubstep kerbal duplicating ultra save-destroying kraken. It was not fun.

Like nemrav said, this is very minor, today the kraken made my computer screen go black and then for some reason when it wasn't black anymore the game had closed itself, not crashed, but closed itself, it was weird.

In my first attempt at landing at Moho, while making the orbital insertion burn something weird happened. Just as my transfer stage was about to run out of fuel, it started clipping through the lander. Then it exploded. I wish I was a bit quicker on the screen-shot button, it was spectacular.

In my first attempt at landing at Moho, while making the orbital insertion burn something weird happened. Just as my transfer stage was about to run out of fuel, it started clipping through the lander. Then it exploded. I wish I was a bit quicker on the screen-shot button, it was spectacular.

Yeah, that happens to me on launch sometimes, especially with a high TWR launcher and a very narrow decoupler connecting the launcher stage and the orbital insertion stage, you can often remedy it by lowering or cutting throttle if you notice the stages flying into each other!
If you use remote tech this is a known bug.
